intro: Enterosora, commonly known as the "false mallow," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves that are often ovate or elliptical in shape. The flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually pink or purple in color. The plant is native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
